text: Analysis of the expression of a translational ywhE-lacZ fusion showed that ywhE expression is sporulation-specific, and is controlled predominantly by the forespore-specific sigma factor sigma(F), and to a lesser extent by sigma(G).

text: The expression of rsfA is under the control of both sigma(F) and sigma(G).

text: We demonstrated that katX is also a sigmaB-dependent general stress gene, since it is strongly induced by heat, salt and ethanol stress, as well as by energy depletion.

text: Taken together, the results support the idea that sequestration of SpoIIE protein into the prespore plays an important role in the control of sigmaF activation and in coupling this activation to septation.
text_with_entity_marker: Taken together, the results support the idea that sequestration of [E1]SpoIIE[/E1] protein into the prespore plays an important role in the control of [E2]sigmaF[/E2] activation and in coupling this activation to septation.

text: sigmaF is controlled by a regulatory cascade involving an anti-sigma factor, SpoIIAB, an anti-anti-sigma factor, SpoIIAA, and a membrane-bound phosphatase, SpoIIE, which converts the inactive, phosphorylated form of SpoIIAA back to the active form.

text: These results suggest that YfhP may act as a negative regulator for the transcription of yfhQ, yfhR, sspE and yfhP.

text: The first stage, which involves the phosphatase function of SpoIIE, depends on the cell division protein FtsZ and could correspond to the FtsZ-dependent assembly of SpoIIE into E-rings.

text: Evidence based on the use of modified and mutant forms of the phosphatase protein indicates that SpoIIE blocks the capacity of unphosphorylated SpoIIAA to activate sigmaF until formation of the polar septum is completed.

text: These results demonstrate that sigmaK-dependent transcription of gerE initiates a negative feedback loop in which GerE acts as a repressor to limit production of sigmaK.

text: A low level of GerE activated transcription of cotD by sigmaK RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of GerE repressed cotD transcription.

text: Furthermore, YtxH and YvyD seemed to be induced after phosphate starvation in the wild type in a sigma(B)-dependent manner and in the sigB mutant probably via sigma(H).

text: DNase I footprinting showed that SpoIIID binds strongly to two sites in the cotC promoter region, binds weakly to one site in the cotX promoter, and does not bind specifically to cotB.

text: Transcription of the cotB, cotC, and cotX genes by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase is activated by a small, DNA-binding protein called GerE.
text_with_entity_marker: Transcription of the cotB, cotC, and [E1]cotX[/E1] genes by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase is activated by a small, DNA-binding protein called [E2]GerE[/E2].

text: SpoIIID at low concentration repressed cotC transcription, whereas a higher concentration only partially repressed cotX transcription and had little effect on cotB transcription.
text_with_entity_marker: SpoIIID at low concentration repressed [E1]cotC[/E1] transcription, whereas a higher concentration only partially repressed cotX transcription and had little effect on [E2]cotB[/E2] transcription.

text: The Bacillus subtilis clpC operon is regulated by two stress induction pathways relying on either sigmaB or a class III stress induction mechanism acting at a sigmaA-like promoter.
text_with_entity_marker: The Bacillus subtilis [E1]clpC[/E1] operon is regulated by two stress induction pathways relying on either sigmaB or a class III stress induction mechanism acting at a [E2]sigmaA[/E2]-like promoter.

text: Our data demonstrate that the CtsR protein acts as a global repressor of the clpC operon, as well as other class III heat shock genes, by preventing unstressed transcription from either the sigmaB- or sigmaA-dependent promoter and might be inactivated or dissociate under inducing stress conditions.
text_with_entity_marker: Our data demonstrate that the [E1]CtsR[/E1] protein acts as a global repressor of the clpC operon, as well as other class III heat shock genes, by preventing unstressed transcription from either the [E2]sigmaB[/E2]- or sigmaA-dependent promoter and might be inactivated or dissociate under inducing stress conditions.

text: The sigmaB-dependent promoter drives expression of yvyD under stress conditions and after glucose starvation, whereas a sigmaH-dependent promoter is responsible for yvyD transcription following amino acid limitation.
text_with_entity_marker: The sigmaB-dependent promoter drives expression of yvyD under stress conditions and after glucose starvation, whereas a [E1]sigmaH[/E1]-dependent promoter is responsible for [E2]yvyD[/E2] transcription following amino acid limitation.

text: This indicates that the yvyD gene product, being a member of both the sigmaB and sigmaH regulons, might negatively regulate the activity of the sigmaL regulon.
text_with_entity_marker: This indicates that the [E1]yvyD[/E1] gene product, being a member of both the sigmaB and [E2]sigmaH[/E2] regulons, might negatively regulate the activity of the sigmaL regulon.

text: In addition to the typical sigmaB-dependent, stress- and starvation-inducible pattern, yvyD is also induced in response to amino acid depletion.
text_with_entity_marker: In addition to the typical [E1]sigmaB[/E1]-dependent, stress- and starvation-inducible pattern, [E2]yvyD[/E2] is also induced in response to amino acid depletion.

text: The addition of ClpX to in vitro transcription reactions resulted in the stimulation of RNAP holoenzyme activity, but sigmaH-RNAP was observed to be more sensitive to ClpX-dependent stimulation than sigmaA-RNAP.

text: Although spo0H is transcriptionally regulated by the key regulatory device that controls sporulation initiation, the Spo0 phosphorelay, there is considerable evidence implicating a mechanism of post-translational control that governs the activity and concentration of sigmaH.

text: The class includes AsiA form bacteriophage T4, which inhibits Escherichia coli sigma 70; FlgM, present in both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, which inhibits the flagella sigma factor sigma 28; SpoIIAB, which inhibits the sporulation-specific sigma factor, sigma F and sigma G, of Bacillus subtilis; RbsW of B. subtilis, which inhibits stress response sigma factor sigma B; and DnaK, a general regulator of the heat shock response, which in bacteria inhibits the heat shock sigma factor sigma 32.

text: The sspH and sspL genes are recognized primarily by the forespore-specific sigma factor for RNA polymerase, sigmaG; the sspN-tlp operon is recognized equally well by sigmaG and the other forespore-specific sigma factor, sigmaF.

text: The sigma W regulon includes a penicillin binding protein (PBP4*) and a co-transcribed amino acid racemase (RacX), homologues of signal peptide peptidase (YteI), flotillin (YuaG), ABC transporters (YknXYZ), non-haem bromoperoxidase (YdjP), epoxide hydrolase (YfhM) and three small peptides with structural similarities to bacteriocin precursor polypeptides.
